HPI 8035 Lancia 037 Evo 1984 Tour de Corse - Rallye de France Winner M. Alén/I. Kivimäki

Purchased: 2012
Manufacturer page: http://www.hpimodelcar.com/en/line_up/index_8035.php

12th WRC win for Markku Alén.
23rd WRC win for Lancia.
Only WRC win for 037 Evo.

For 1984, Lancia's aim was to defend its Manufacturer' Title. However, Walter Röhrl left the team to take up a seat with Audi, whose all-wheel drive Quattro was becoming increasingly competitive. Audi was absolutely determined to take Lancia's Manufacturers' crown to add to the Drivers' Title it had secured in 1983 with the Finn Hannu Mikkola.

The German squad achieved its aim, winning both titles in 1984, although the Lancia 037 had one final moment of glory in Corsica. Markku Alén used the nimble, rear-wheel drive machine to great effect, capturing his second straight victory on the island. The general consensus, however, was that two-wheel-drive was now far too great a technical handicap in the wake of Audi's domination with the all-wheel-drive Quattro.

This would be the last time a rear-wheel drive vehicle would win a WRC event. Lancia continued racing the 037 in the 1985 WRC season but it just could not compete with the new all-wheel drive Peugeot 205T16s and Audi Quattros.
